title: Calorie Count in In-N-Out Hamburger
meta_description: Discover the calorie count in In-N-Out hamburger, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for their classic menu item.
assumptions: Standard single patty hamburger with bun, beef patty, lettuce, tomato, onion, and spread; no modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and customizations; values based on official In-N-Out data. Check app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: One In-N-Out hamburger has 390 kcal, with 16 g protein and 19 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with fast food info.

tweaks.label: Animal Style (extra spread, mustard, grilled onions)

faqs.q: What is the calorie count in In-N-Out hamburger?
faqs.a: Approximately 390 kcal for the standard hamburger.

faqs.q: How much protein is in an In-N-Out burger?
faqs.a: About 16 g of protein per standard hamburger.

faqs.q: Are In-N-Out calories high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 670 mg sodium per hamburger due to the spread and bun.

faqs.q: What changes the calorie count in In-N-Out items?
faqs.a: Customizations like cheese, extra patties, or Animal Style add 100â€“200 kcal.

faqs.q: How do In-N-Out fries compare in calories?
faqs.a: A medium order of fries has about 370 kcal, similar to the hamburger.
